spinner.description: This will set the default CPU governor. Default CPU governor will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default CPU Governor

spinner.description: Scaling maximum frequency (Default: 1.2Ghz)
spinner.name: Scaling Max Freq

spinner.description: Scaling minimum frequency (Default: 200Mhz)
spinner.name: Scaling Min Freq

spinner.description: This sets the smooth scaling level which prevents ondemand based governors to jump directly to maximum frequency, with load spikes. (Kuban Default: 600MHz)(Samsung Default: 1.2GHz)
spinner.name: Smooth Scaling Level

spinner.description: This setting will change CPU step count (Restart required).
spinner.name: CPU Step Count

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Hotplug Mode. Hotplug mode will dynamically switch the second core on and off. Using second core always-off or always-on modes will make the other hotplug parameters useless.
spinner.name: Hotplug Mode

seekBar.description: The second core will turn on when the load goes above this threshold (load_h0)(Kuban Default: 30)
seekBar.name: Second Core On

seekBar.description: The second core will turn off when the load goes below this threshold (load_l1)(Kuban Default: 20)
seekBar.name: Second Core Off

seekBar.description: If the second core has less than this many threads, and it's load is less than Load_rq the second core will be disabled. This will override load_l1 (Kuban Default: 2)
seekBar.name: Min_rq

seekBar.description: (Kuban Default: 20)
seekBar.name: Load_rq

seekBar.description: Sets hot plug sampling intervals for screen-on state (Kuban Default: 200)
seekBar.name: rate

seekBar.description: Sets the frequency below which second core will not be turned on, regardless of thresholds. (Kuban Default: 600000)
seekBar.name: freq_min

spinner.description: Sets the CPU undervolting value which will be applied during boot time only. It will not have any effect until you restart your device. Remember: if you change this value and your device doesn't boot you will have to reset extweaks settings using CWM recovery. This value will be applied to all CPU steps before any script or app execution. If you use any script or voltage control app this setting may be overriden by those.
spinner.name: CPU Undervolting

spinner.description: Sets the CPU Idle Mode. AFTR+LPA is the default and best for the battery life. If you have problems try Idle+LPA. (IDLE - Clock is gated, Power to CPU cores remains)(AFTR - Clock is gated, Power to the CPU cores is removed)(LPA - Cache power is turned off
spinner.name: CPU Idle Mode

spinner.description: This will enable or disable profiles.
spinner.name: Enable Profiles

settingsPane.description: Set the profiles priority (They must not be the same)
settingsPane.name: Priority

spinner.description: Highest Priority
spinner.name: priority1

spinner.description: Middle Priority
spinner.name: priority2

spinner.description: Lowest Priority
spinner.name: priority3

settingsPane.description: Set all of the screen off profile options. These only apply when the sceen is turned off.
settingsPane.name: Screen Off Settings

spinner.description: This will enable or disable the Screen Off profile.
spinner.name: Enable Screen Off

spinner.description: This will set the Screen Off CPU governor. (Kuban Default: Hyper)
spinner.name: Screen Off CPU Governor

spinner.description: The maximum frequency allowed when the screen is off
spinner.name: Screen Off Scaling Max Freq

spinner.description: The minimum frequency allowed when the screen is off
spinner.name: Screen Off Scaling Min Freq

spinner.description: This will enable or disable the Screen Off I/O profile.
spinner.name: Enable I/O

spinner.description: This will set the Screen Off I/O scheduler. (Kuban Default: NOOP)
spinner.name: Screen Off I/O Scheduler

settingsPane.description: This will Set the options below while the phone is charging.
settingsPane.name: Charging Settings

spinner.description: This will enable or disable the Charging profile.
spinner.name: Enable Charging

spinner.description: This will set the charging CPU governor.
spinner.name: Charging CPU Governor

spinner.description: The maximum frequency allowed when charging
spinner.name: Charging Scaling Max Freq

spinner.description: The minimum frequency allowed when charging
spinner.name: charging Scaling Min Freq

settingsPane.description: Set all of the low power profile options. These only apply when the the battery is lower that the Low Power Amount.
settingsPane.name: Low Power Settings
Low Power Settings

spinner.description: This will enable or disable the Low Power profile.
spinner.name: Enable Low Battery

seekBar.description: The amount the battery should be at before the battery profile starts.
seekBar.name: Low Power Amount

spinner.description: This will set the low power CPU governor.
spinner.name: Low Power CPU Governor

spinner.description: The maximum frequency allowed when in low power state
spinner.name: Low Power Scaling Max Freq

spinner.description: The minimum frequency allowed when in low power state
spinner.name: Low Power Scaling Min Freq

spinner.description: Changes the first (lowest) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step1

spinner.description: Changes the second (middle) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step2

spinner.description: Changes the third (last) GPU frequency step
spinner.name: GPU Freq Step3

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the first (lowest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level1

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the second (middle) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level2

seekBar.description: GPU Voltage for the third (highest) step
seekBar.name: GPU Voltage Level3

settingsPane.description: GPU load thresholds to change between frequency steps
settingsPane.name: GPU Thresholds

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from first to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 1-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from second to first step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-DOWN

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump up from second to third step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 2-UP

seekBar.description: GPU threshold to jump down from third to second step
seekBar.name: GPU Threshold 3-DOWN

settingsPane.description: The number of cycles that the GPU stays at the specific level. (Samsung Defaults: 1,1 and 1)(Kuban Defaults: 0,0 and 1)
settingsPane.name: GPU StayCount

seekBar.description: GPU first (for the lowest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount1

seekBar.description: GPU second (for the middle freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount2

seekBar.description: GPU third (for the highest freq) StayCount
seekBar.name: GPU StayCount3

seekBar.description: Hung Task Timeout in Seconds (Samsung Default: 0)(Kuban Default: 30)
seekBar.name: Hung Task Timeout

seekBar.description: If this is zero, the kernel will loop on a panic; if non-zero it indicates that the kernel should autoreboot after this number of seconds. (Samsung Default: 1)(Kuban Default: 30)
seekBar.name: Kernel Panic

seekBar.description: The number of read bits required for waking up processes that sleep (Samsung Default: 64)(Kuban Default: 256)
seekBar.name: Read Wakeup Threshold

seekBar.description: The number of write bits required for waking up processes that sleep (Samsung Default: 128)(Kuban Default: 256)
seekBar.name: Write Wakeup Threshold

spinner.description: This will set the default I/O scheduler. Default I/O scheduler will only be set during early stages of booting (before init.d execution) and can be overriden by later scripts or apps.
spinner.name: Default I/O Scheduler

spinner.description: SD Read Ahead (Samsung Default: 256)(Kuban Default: 4096)
spinner.name: SD Read Ahead

spinner.description: Charge current setting
spinner.name: Charge Current

spinner.description: Change USB connection mode. Either leave it as default or force it to mass storage mode (you will see your sdcards as disks) or mtp
spinner.name: USB Mass Storage Mode

settingsPane.description: As you write out data ultimately intended for disk, Linux caches this information in an area of memory called the page cache. Tweak how these settings work
settingsPane.name: Memory Settings

seekBar.description: VFS Cache Pressure (Samsung Default: 100)(Kuban Default: 10)
seekBar.name: VFS Cache Pressure

seekBar.description: Maximum percentage of active that can be filled with dirty pages before pdflush begins to write them (Samsung Default: 0)(Kuban Default: 5)
seekBar.name: Dirty Background Ratio

seekBar.description: In hundredths of a second, how long data can be in the page cache before it's considered expired and must be written at the next opportunity (Samsung Default: 200)(Kuban Default: 1000)
seekBar.name: Dirty Expire Centisecs

seekBar.description: Maximum percentage of total memory that can be filled with dirty pages before processes are forced to write dirty buffers themselves during their time slice instead of being allowed to do more writes (Samsung Default: 20)(Kuban Default: 90)
seekBar.name: Dirty Ratio

seekBar.description: In hundredths of a second, this is how often pdflush wakes up to write data to disk (Samsung Default: 500)(Kuban Default: 2000)
seekBar.name: Dirty Writeback Centisecs

seekBar.description: A swappiness setting of zero means that the disk will be avoided unless absolutely necessary (you run out of memory), while a swappiness setting of 100 means that programs will be swapped to disk almost instantly (Samsung Default: 0)(Kuban Default: 50)
seekBar.name: Swappiness

seekBar.description: TCP Keep Alive Time (Samsung Default: 7200)(Kuban Default: 1800)
seekBar.name: TCP Keep Alive Time

seekBar.description: The tcp_keepalive_probes variable tells the kernel how many TCP keepalive probes to sendout before it decides a specific connection is broken. (Samsung Default: 9)(Kuban Default: 5)
seekBar.name: TCP Keep Alive Probes

seekBar.description: The tcp_keepalive_intvl variable tells the kernel how long to wait for a reply on each keep alive probe. (Samsung Default: 72)(Kuban Default: 20)
seekBar.name: TCP Keep Alive Intvl

spinner.description: The tcp_timestamps variable tells the kernel to use timestamps as de?ned in RFC 1323. Inshort, this is an TCP option that can be used to calculate the Round Trip Measurement in abetter way than the retransmission timeout method can (Samsung Default: On)(Kuban Default: Off)
spinner.name: TCP Timestamps

spinner.description: This variable enables the fast recycling function of TIME-WAIT sockets (Samsung Default: Off)(Kuban Default: On)
spinner.name: TCP Recycle

spinner.description: If this value is set to On, the kernel chooses to totally ignore all ICMP Echo requests (Samsung Default: Off)(Kuban Default: On)
spinner.name: ICMP Echo Ignore All

seekBar.description: The tcp_max_syn_backlog variable tells your box how many SYN requests to keep in memory. (Samsung Default: 512)(Kuban Default: 4096)
seekBar.name: TCP Max SYN Backlog

spinner.description: Enable or Disable Screen Gestures (Kuban Default: Off)
spinner.name: Screen Gestures

spinner.description: 1 finger at the top left and one finger at the bottom left swipe both to the right
spinner.name: Gesture 1

spinner.description: Draw a Z
spinner.name: Gesture 2

spinner.description: 1 finger on the top left one on the bottom left both go to the middle right
spinner.name: Gesture 3

spinner.description: Draw a heart starting in the bottom middle of the screen
spinner.name: Gesture 4

spinner.description: Draw a Traingle starting in the Top middle going Counterclockwise
spinner.name: Gesture 5

spinner.description: Draw a Diamond starting in the Top middle going clockwise
spinner.name: Gesture 6

spinner.description: Draw a \ starting in the Bottom right going to the Top left then back
spinner.name: Gesture 7

spinner.description: Draw a \ starting in the Top left going to the Bottom right then back
spinner.name: Gesture 8

spinner.description: 1 finger from the bottom left to the bottom right back to the bottom left
spinner.name: Gesture 9

spinner.description: 1 finger from the Top left to the Top right back to the Top left
spinner.name: Gesture 10

seekBar.description: Touch Sensitivity Lower value = higher sensitivity (Samsung Default: 40)(Kuban Default: 0)
seekBar.name: Touch Sensitivity

seekBar.description: Wifi Scan Interval (Samsung Default: 15)(Kuban Default: 180)
seekBar.name: Wifi Scan Interval

button.description: If you think that the fuel gauge behaving weird use this button to reset it. Give it a few hours after you reset the gauge. It may still show you funny values for that period, Then the battery percentage should be fine.
button.name: Reset Fuel-Gauge
button.label: Reset Fuel-Gauge
